intro: Unona queenslandica, commonly known as the Queensland lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland and rainforest areas. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and it produces clusters of pale yellow to white blooms. Unona queenslandica is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
